content: Now it is ALL quite clear to me and at least I have a better understanding of the Republican Party Rule and where they come from. It's nothing new either. "If the President says so, It's not illegal". Nixon said the same thing. "http://www.smirkingchimp.com/thread/21602" and I was almost fooled to believe we lived in a democratic society with checks and balances. Learning everyday that the Republican Party is NOT the ones I want in control, fiscal conservative or not.

content: as for the article....It wasn't a "brief Q & A with some Stanford students". it was an ambush. hate on Bush all you want but Condi seems pretty classy to me. I may not agre with her, but then again....I'm not sure she believes everything shes said in her line of work. I always kinda felt like she was "just doing her job". and her job was to take positions she may not always agre with. I could be wrong but thats just the impression I get about her.
reply: as for the article....It wasn't a "brief Q & A with some Stanford students". it was an ambush. hate on Bush all you want but Condi seems pretty classy to me. title: C. Rice's Nixon Moment

content: quote: Originally posted by karlhungusjr: quote: Originally posted by adminnco1: It looks like someone just watched Frost-Nixon. I enjoyed it but felt is granted far more emotion to Nixon than he ever experienced in real life. is it worth buying? I almost picked it up the other day but decided against it until I got some opinions on it. As a practice I seldom purchase movies but this is one I would certainly consider owning. While it grants Nixon far more emotion than I believe he possessed, in general it presents him in a fair manner. He was, after all, a master politician and that shows through clearly. It is definitely not a "feel good" film, but it is one that will get you thinking about Nixon, journalism and politics in general.
quote: Originally posted by karlhungusjr: quote: Originally posted by adminnco1: It looks like someone just watched Frost-Nixon. I enjoyed it but felt is granted far more emotion to Nixon than he ever experienced in real life. is it worth buying? I almost picked it up the other day but decided against it until I got some opinions on it.
reply: As a practice I seldom purchase movies but this is one I would certainly consider owning. While it grants Nixon far more emotion than I believe he possessed, in general it presents him in a fair manner. He was, after all, a master politician and that shows through clearly. It is definitely not a "feel good" film, but it is one that will get you thinking about Nixon, journalism and politics in general.

title: C. Rice's Nixon Moment

content: quote: As a practice I seldom purchase movies but this is one I would certainly consider owning. While it grants Nixon far more emotion than I believe he possessed, in general it presents him in a fair manner. He was, after all, a master politician and that shows through clearly. It is definitely not a "feel good" film, but it is one that will get you thinking about Nixon, journalism and politics in general. awesome. thanks man. I think I'll pick it up pretty soon.
quote: As a practice I seldom purchase movies but this is one I would certainly consider owning.
